snippet: Derek Fisher is the best choice by far if Phil Jackson wants to coach without coaching, mentor a former player and, if all goes exceedingly well, cement a legacy as a championship coach who became a championship executive.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of the Times column examines decision to make Derek Fisher new coach of New York Knicks; notes that Fisher played for Knicks president Phil Jackson during his very successful years coaching the Los Angeles Lakers; agrees with Fisher that to be successful, team will have to find a new play format that focuses more on teamwork and less on star power.
lead_paragraph: Derek Fisher is the best choice by far if Phil Jackson wants to coach without coaching, mentor a former player and, if all goes exceedingly well, cement a legacy as a championship coach who became a championship executive.

headline.seo: Knicks Coach Derek Fisher Knows Basketball but Inherits a Flawed Team
headline.main: Championship Experience, if Not a Championship Roster
headline.print_headline: Championship Experience, if Not a Championship Roster
